title: Baggies (clothing)
text:
"Baggies" was a name given to a particular type of <a href="Jeans">jean</a> in the early 1980s in the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a>. The jeans were designed to be loose fitting around the leg, with a tight zip or button around the ankle, and had a number of <a href="Zipper">zip</a>s with <a href="pocket">pocket</a>s primarily down the front of the jean. Typically there may have been ten or more pockets on the front of the jeans. They would frequently been worn with another 1980s <a href="fashion%20accessory">fashion accessory</a>, the <a href="Blacklight%20paint">day-glo</a> sock, which was a <a href="Terrycloth">terry towelling</a> sock typically coloured in bright yellow, pink, or light blue.
Before the popular 'baggy clothing' introduced by <a href="MC%20Hammer">MC Hammer</a> of the late '80s and early '90s, there was the dress style Baggies. This style of clothing is best symbolized as dress style clothing. The most fashionable representation of these type of outfits was the pants along with a dress shirt, a thin tie, a fancy <a href="blazer">blazer</a> coat and dress shoes. The best example of this clothing and outfits were worn by the <a href="Minneapolis">Minneapolis</a> based band known as "<a href="The%20Time%20%28band%29">The Time</a>" (headed by frontman <a href="Morris%20Day">Morris Day</a>).
